result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert R Eaton was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 6/26/2019 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of 179 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $3,000.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------------------

Must attend Victim Impact Panel (VIP) annually for each year of Extended Supervision. 
-------------------------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
-------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to enter any bars or liquor stores.
-------------------------------------
Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. Not to operate a  vehicle without a properly installed IID.
-------------------------------------

Pay Psychiatric Evaluation fees in the amount of $1,080.00.
-------------------------------------
Pay DA Service fees in the amount of $320.00.
-------------------------------------
Pay Sheriff's Warrant fees in the amount of $62.12.
-------------------------------------

Transcript of Motion hearing before the Hon. David M. Reddy on August 8, 2014
Court Reporter:  Eileen Walsh Grzenia
#S1 - Officer Milligan's Report - offered and received

Defendant Robert R Eaton in court with attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court for hearing on 2 Motions filed by the Defense - Motion to Quash Arrest and Suppress Evidence and Defendant's Motion in Limine to Exclude HGN evidence at trial.  Officer's testimony taken with regard to the Motion to Suppress.  Argument by Attorneys.  Court would like parties to file Briefs.  A transcript will be needed and can be prepared in the next two weeks.  State's Brief is due September 12th.  Defense Brief is due September 19th.  Court will either issue a written Decision on this Motion or will decide this at the Final Pre-trial.  

Court proceeds with Daubert Motion on HGN.  Court will address this by offer or proof or arugment.  Attorneys advise Court they have nothing to add to the Briefs they have submitted.  Court makes findings and denies the Defendant's Motion as to HGN.  10:36 a.m.  Court in recess.  Minutes filed.
